summary: pnpm package manager support is needed for the TypeScript SDK. Currently webpack builds fail with pnpm due to its hoisted module structure, requiring workaround using shamefully-hoist flag. Discussion concluded that users should install @temporalio/* packages directly instead of the temporalio package.
userImpact: Users trying to use pnpm with the TypeScript SDK encounter webpack build failures and must use workarounds like shamefully-hoist flag.
rootCause: pnpm's non-hoisted module structure (node_modules in workspace subdirectories) differs from npm/yarn, causing webpack configuration issues during builds.
proposedFix: Document that users should install @temporalio/* packages directly rather than the temporalio package when using yarn or pnpm.
workaround: Add shamefully-hoist=true option to pnpm configuration to revert to npm/yarn style module locations.
resolutionDetails: Team decided not to modify the package structure but instead document that users should import from @temporalio/* packages directly when using yarn/pnpm, avoiding the monolithic temporalio package.
keyQuote: Don't install the `temporalio` package if you're using yarn or pnpm. Instead, install the `@temporalio/*` packages that you import from.
